column2:
'They used tweezers to pull it out'
'Just thinking about that hurts!'
"I couldn't watch it happen. Have you had any similar injuries?"
"I've had plenty of splinters, but I cannot imagine an ingrown toenail."
"That's lucky. I recently broke my ankle and I am in a cast."
'Wow!  When I was younger, I fell running and broke my arm. How is your ankle doing?'
'Hopping over a fence.'
'How tall was the fence?'
'Not tall. But it was very rainy out.'
'Sorry to hear that.  How much longer do you have to be in the cast?'
"Not sure yet. I have an appointment on Friday to find out. Fingers crossed it isn't more than three months."
"Let's hope for the best.  I went to the doctor recently for a cold; I've been taking Vitamin C to see if it helps."

- 这两件衣服的颜色相同。

"No idea. I didn't deserve that. "
"No one deserves that for no reason. How are you dealing with it?"

"I'll get over it. I keep busy. Like soon, I have to go pick up my little sister. She's in the first grade. "
"Kids are a great way to keep your mind off of things! Little sisters can be company to go out and adventure with."

"Yeah, I have 4 siblings. They are a blast to hang out with. Do you have any?"
"Yes, I have one, but I have four kids. Two are grown and two are school age. They hold each together when they need someone."

"That is so nice. I can't imagine having 4 kids. I have one and one is enough!"
"Yes, We just moved from the beach. We fished and spent the summer at the beach. It was good family time."

"I once lived 10 minutes from the Gulf. It was such a nice place to live. I miss it. What beach did you visit?"
"We lived in Corpus Christi. We fished on Padre Island. Where did you live?"

"Lake Jackson, TX. I managed a resturant there and spent days off at Surfside Beach. I love Padre Island. "
"My grandma lives in Freeport. I spent my childhood summers there! I love it."

"I was supposed to go on a skiing trip, but it's been canceled."
"Well, maybe it can be rescheduled?"

"I hope so.  I love to ski; have you ever been?"
"No, I don't care for the cold weather being from the south. Besides, I'm busy studying. I speak 6 languages. "

"I am from the South, also.  I also like to go outside and skate.  What languages do you speak?"
"English, Spanish, French, Russian, German, and Navajo. Do you speak any other languages?"

"That is an impressive list.  I speak English and Korean.  "
"Yes, I went last year on a business trip. What do you study?"

"Yes, I went last year on a business trip.  What do you study?"
"I study languages. What Korean dish would you recommend for me to eat? I like to cook. "

"You have to make bulgogi.  You can eat it by itself, with vegetables, or rice."
"Now I'm hungry. I'll have to look that up and try it. Thanks."

"I hope they don't drink while doing the Roofing!!" 
"Lol well some people can sneak in drinks but I'm not too sure if its allowed. I usually just order a tea, which they do have."
"I can't say I relate to that. How do you feel about it?"
"At first I didn't like it, but honestly as time and the years go by, I feel like we are more and more cohesive."
"Who is we? I thought you only cared about yourself."
"Sorry, I call myself we when I had one too many drinks. I have the ability to care for others on occasion."
"LOL. Sort of like the Royal We. What are you drinking?"
"Yes, the Royal we! I am drinking Modelo because thats what my coworkers at roofing inc. drink."
"Whatever works for you!"
"I can't say it has worked for me though. I have believed myself a ruler of the world but still live in this box."
"I think we all feel that way at some point."
"Right! But the difference with me is I just think about myself and no one else really. People consider it a social and cultural problem."

column2:
"It's a nice place to visit, but living here is a different story. I miss the simple life."
"I bet you had culture shock. My parents also visited NY last year; it was their 40th wedding anniversary."

"Wow, 40 years. Nice. I hope my wife and I make it that long. We've been married 3.5 years. Are you married?"
"Yes, I'm married. We are going on 5 years. I met my wife at a bookstore. How did you meet yours?"

"We met scuba diving. We both love it. What do you two do together?"
"Scuba diving sounds fun. We do two book clubs together. One is for non-fiction, and one is for fiction. We also travel."

"We also love to travel and I'm a reader. Where was your last trip to?"
"We traveled to South Africa and are planning a trip to Ireland next year. How about y'all?"

"Wow! We went to Grand Canyon last summer. I lived there for 5 years, so we went back to see friends. Ireland! That sounds great."
"We would love to do a cross country road trip. Grand Canyon sounds fun."

"It was a great place to live. I could see the canyon from my office window. I miss it."
"That sounds like quite a view. How does it compare to the NY skyline?"
